agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Homeland Security & Public Safety TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 3, 2019 PLACE: E2.016 CHAIR: Rep. Poncho Nevárez *** There will be a two minute limit on testimony. *** The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair. HB 2048 Zerwas | et al. Relating to the repeal of the driver responsibility program and the amount and allocation of state traffic fine funds; eliminating program surcharges; authorizing and increasing criminal fines; increasing a fee. HB 292 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to inclusion of instruction on the trafficking of persons in the basic training curriculum for peace officers. HB 482 Thompson, Senfronia | et al. Relating to a limitation on the authority to arrest a person for certain misdemeanors punishable by fine only. HB 3800 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to required reporting of human trafficking cases by peace officers and prosecutors. HB 943 Dutton Relating to an offense report prepared in the investigation of a criminal case. HB 2015 Dutton | et al. Relating to searches, seizures and raids by Special Weapons and Tactics teams. HB 3416 Geren Relating to hiring and licensing certain persons as peace officers. HB 2475 Guillen Relating to the indigent status of a person for purposes of the driver responsibility program. HB 1505 Martinez Relating to the recording of a criminal offense of transporting household goods without registration in a driving record. HB 3503 Anderson, Charles "Doc" Relating to firearms training for county jailers. HB 3082 Murphy Relating to investigating and prosecuting the criminal offense of operating an unmanned aircraft over or near certain facilities. HB 1890 Price Relating to emergency contact and medical information maintained by the Department of Public Safety. HB 2404 Bell, Cecil Relating to establishment of the office of first responder support within the Bill Blackwood Law Enforcement Management Institute of Texas and to the provision of critical incident support services to first responders; requiring occupational certification. HB 3016 Schaefer Relating to the carrying of a firearm by a licensee in a motor vehicle. HB 1692 Leach Relating to allowing safety recall information to be included in a vehicle inspection report. HB 1769 Bonnen, Greg | et al. Relating to the creation of a statewide alert system for missing adults and to a study of the alert system. HB 3231 Clardy Relating to the regulation of firearms, air guns, knives, ammunition, or firearm or air gun supplies or accessories by a county or municipality. HB 264 Blanco Relating to a report by the Department of Public Safety of certain information on border crime and other criminal activity related to border security. HB 3063 Smithee Relating to the transfer of a retired county or municipal law enforcement animal. HJR 96 Tinderholt | et al. Proposing a constitutional amendment to allow the transfer of a law enforcement animal to a qualified caretaker in certain circumstances. HB 751 Bailes Relating to establishment of the office of first responder support within the Bill Blackwood Law Enforcement Management Institute of Texas; requiring occupational certification. HB 3706 Dean Relating to a license to carry a handgun for active and retired railroad peace officers and special cattle rangers; authorizing a fee. HB 1399 Smith | et al. Relating to the creation and storage of DNA records for a person arrested for a felony offense. HB 1236 Goodwin | et al. Relating to the carrying of handguns on the campuses of and certain other locations associated with institutions of higher education. HB 2280 Goodwin Relating to the notice given by a property owner prohibiting a handgun license holder from carrying a handgun on certain property. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 34 HB 107 HB 887 HB 1546 HB 1750 HB 2560 HB 2696 HB 3096 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
